summary: Retrieve exact line ranges or whole heading blocks from a cached source. Use colon syntax for single spans, `--lines` for multi-range pulls, and `-C all` (or `--context all`, legacy `--block`) when you need the entire section.

usage.description: Primary pattern for single spans. Context expands Â±3 lines.
Opinionated multi-range variant (returns JSON with combined content and lineNumbers).
Heading-aware retrieval. Expands to the enclosing section and caps the payload to 80 lines.

options.impact: Expands each range. Keep N small (0-3) for prompt efficiency. Legacy: -c<N>
Return the entire heading that contains the requested lines (great for API intros, tables, or multi-step guides). Primary method for full section retrieval.
Legacy alias for -C all. Still supported but -C all is preferred.
Hard limit when using --context all so agents avoid oversized payloads.
Structured payload containing alias, content, lineNumbers, and checksum.
Emit OSC 52 sequence so compatible terminals copy the result.

agent_playbook: Feed the `alias:lines` string from `blz search --format json` directly into `blz get <alias>:<lines> -C 3 --format text` for the primary span.
When the same alias requires multiple segments, invoke `blz get <alias> --lines "range1,range2" -C 2 --format json` and merge the JSON result into your tool output.
When you need a complete explanation, prefer `blz get <alias>:<lines> -C all --max-lines 80 --format json` so the heading, subheadings, and prose arrive in one payload.
Store the checksum returned by the JSON mode alongside your prompt payload to catch stale caches.
error_handling: If a range falls outside the cached document, re-run `blz search` to confirm the alias/lines combination and update the source if necessary.
If content looks outdated, run `blz update <alias>` before fetching spans again.
